p: Viral strains or cell lines expressing reporter proteins are also used to assess the efficacy of BSAAs in infected cells. For example, TZM-bl cells expressing firefly luciferase under control of HIV-1 LTR promoter allowed quantitation of BSAA action on HIV-1 infection (tat-protein expression by integrated HIV-1 provirus) using firefly luciferase assay ( Sarzotti-Kelsoe et al., 2014, Xing et al., 2016). RFP-expressing RVFV, nanoLuc-expressing CHIKV and RRV, as well as GFP-expressing FLUAV, HCV and HMPV also allowed identification of novel activities of several BSAAs ( Andersen et al., 2019b, Bosl et al., 2019, de Graaf et al., 2007, Habjan et al., 2008, Ianevski et al., 2018, Jupille et al., 2011, Kittel et al., 2004, Lee et al., 2017, Utt et al., 2016). In addition, qPCR/RT-qPCR, RNA/DNA sequencing, RNA/DNA hybridization, immuno- and plaque assays as well as CRISPR-Cas9 systems could be used for detection of inhibitory effects of BSAAs ( Boonham et al., 2014, Fischer et al., 2017, Konig et al., 2019, Laamiri et al., 2018, Landry, 1990, Perez et al., 2013, Sashital, 2018, Zhou et al., 2018). Interestingly, CRISPR-Cas9, siRNA and shRNA approaches were used for identification of BSAA targets ( Deans et al., 2016, Puschnik et al., 2017).
